props.helptext: GPIO encoding bitmap {Format 0xXX (LSB), 0xXX, 0xXX, 0xXX(MSB)}: function[3:0] | gpio[13:4] | direction[14] -> 0 - INPUT, 1 = OUTPUT | pull[16:15] -> 0 - NO_PULL, 1 - PULL_DOWN, 2 - PULL_UP | drive_strength[20:17] -> 0 - 1.6mA, 1 - 2.7mA, 2 - 4mA | gpio_version[31:28] -> 2, I2C Core Clock Frequency: i2c core clock frequency in KHz (ex. 20 MHz = 0x00004E20 KHz)

GPIO encoding {Format 0xXX (LSB), 0xXX, 0xXX, 0xXX(MSB)}: 1st 8 bits = pull[7:4] -> 0 - NO_PULL, 1 - PULL_DOWN, 2 - PULL_UP | direction[3:0] -> 0 - INPUT, 1 = OUTPUT , 2nd 8 bits = drive_strength[7:4] -> 0 - 1.6mA, 1 - 2.7mA, 2 - 4mA | function[3:0], 3rd 8 bits = gpio pin[7:0] -> pin number, 4th 8 bits {unused[7:0] -> Reserved

GPIO encoding {Format (MSB)0x(4)XX(3)XX(2)XX(1)XX(LSB)}: 1st LSB 8 bits = 1st 8 bits = pull[7:4] -> 0 - NO_PULL, 1 - PULL_DOWN, 2 - PULL_UP | direction[3:0] -> 0 - INPUT, 1 = OUTPUT , 2nd 8 bits = drive_strength[7:4] -> 0 - 1.6mA, 1 - 2.7mA, 2 - 4mA | function[3:0], 3rd 8 bits = gpio pin[7:0] -> pin number, 4th 8 bits {unused[7:0] -> Reserved

GPIO encoding {Format (MSB)0x(4)XX(3)XX(2)XX(1)XX(LSB)}: 1st LSB 8 bits = 1st 8 bits = pull[7:4] -> 0 - NO_PULL, 1 - PULL_DOWN, 2 - PULL_UP | direction[3:0] -> 0 - INPUT, 1 = OUTPUT , 2nd 8 bits = drive_strength[7:4] -> 0 - 1.6mA, 1 - 2.7mA, 2 - 4mA | function[3:0], 3rd 8 bits = gpio pin[7:0] -> pin number, 4th 8 bits {unused[7:0] -> Reserved

C struct containing power manager related data.
Maximum number of open crypto objects
Maximum number of concurrent crypto operations
SSL Certificates mount path in flash
Persistent Object mount path in flash
Support FWD Numbers ( 2 - support two FWDs, 3 - support three FWDs)
Good battery reference level, valid range: 2100 to 2800 (2.1 V to 2.8 V)
low power I2S word select pin
I2S sleep control(1-ECON HFLPO, 2-ECON XTAL, 3-ECON PLL, 4-Normal)
Network buffers profile (1 - Performance, 2 - Best effort, 3 - Memory optimized)
Time to first DNS client retry (in seconds)
Maximum number of DNS client retries
Enable IPv4 offload stack (1 - Enable, 0 - Disable)
Size (in bytes) of TCP Send window
Size (in bytes) of TCP Receive window
Maximum number of IPv6 routing entries
Maximum SSL Record/Fragment size (in bytes) support
Maximum number of concurrent HTTP client connections
Maximum number of supported ALPN protocols
User name to login HTTP server
User password to login HTTP server
Age (in seconds) of stale entry in ND cache
Number of pools for custom network buffer profile
Custom network buffer profile default configuration
SNTP client initial poll interval in seconds (min=15)
SNTP client poll interval in seconds once time is acquired (min=15, should be more than initial to save power)
SNTP server to use by SNTP client
The threshold to use shared inbuf for SSL, if the value = 16385, it means disable SSL shared inbuf. If customer wants to use shared inbuf, set it less than 16385.
0: High Speed Uart Port; 1: Debug Uart Port
0: Uart Flow Control Disable; 1:Uart Flow Control Enable
number of service queues for UART interface
service queue id list for UART interface
number of service queues for SPI interface
service queue id list for SPI interface
DTLS handshake timeout for Thread commissioning
Maximum number of children (REED/SED/ED) when acting as a Router.

var_seq.name: zb_manufacturer
var_seq.helptext: Value of the Basic cluster's ManufacturerName attribute

var_seq.name: zb_model
var_seq.helptext: Value of the Basic cluster's ModelIdentifier attribute

var_seq.name: zb_date
var_seq.helptext: Value of the Basic cluster's DateCode attribute

var_seq.name: zb_sw_build
var_seq.helptext: Value of the Basic cluster's SWBuildID attribute

props.helptext: Period in milliseconds the parent is polled when configured as a sleepy device
Value of the Basic cluster's ApplicationVersion attribute
Value of the Basic cluster's StackVersion attribute
Value of the Basic cluster's HWVersion attribute
Size of the NWK address map table
props.id_name: ZigBee Config NWK addr map table size

props.helptext: Size of the NWK BTT table
props.id_name: ZigBee Config NWK BTT table size

props.helptext: Maximum number of outstanding NWK packets
Size fo the NWK neighbor table
props.id_name: ZigBee Config NWK neighbor table size

props.helptext: Size of the NWK route table
props.id_name: ZigBee Config NWK route table size

props.helptext: Number of bits in the Rrec hash table (the actual size of the table is 2^n)
props.id_name: ZigBee Config NWK RRec table bits

props.helptext: Overflow entries for the RRec hash table
props.id_name: ZigBee Config NWK RRec table overflow

props.helptext: Size of the NWK RReq table
props.id_name: ZigBee Config NWK RReq table size

props.helptext: Size of the APS binding table
props.id_name: ZigBee Config APS binding table size

props.helptext: Number of device key pairs that can be retained
props.id_name: ZigBee Config APS device key pair count

props.helptext: Size of the APS group table
props.id_name: ZigBee Config APS group table size
ZigBee Config APS max packet size

props.helptext: LQI to cost mapping. Each byte represents the minimum LQI value for link cost 1..6
props.id_name: ZigBee Config NWK LQI Cost mapping

props.helptext: Max Numbers of Connnection allowed in SoftAp mode
Max number of Outstanding asynchronous DataSet
Max number of persistent list for p2p
WLAN FW Flow control enable/disable Flag
WLAN FW error dump enable/disable flag
WLAN FW bridge mode relay data base size
Max Number of Sockets supported in system
Enable Null data tx after device comes out of suspend state
Max number of clients supported in DHCPv4 server
Configure which device use OTP MAC address
1-Single, Shared Antenna; 2-Dual Antenna, Low Isolation; 3-Dual Antenna, High Isolation; 7-Single, Shared Antenna, switched rx
antenna configuration for 2G band, lower nibble correspond to Tx and higher nibble correspond to Rx config in each byte, Byte 0- Antenna1,Byte 1- Antenna2,Byte 2 -Antenna3,Byte 3 -Antenna4
antenna configuration for 5G band, lower nibble correspond to Tx and higher nibble correspond to Rx config in each byte, Byte 0- Antenna1,Byte 1- Antenna2,Byte 2 -Antenna3,Byte 3 -Antenna4
Collect WLAN error log through outOfBand interrupt
Future use (flag to enable/disable WLAN suspend/resume feature)
Flag to enable Stack offlaod feature
Host interface SDIO/SPI bus clock frequency in Hz
Width of the SDIO BUS to operate(1 or 4 bit mode)
WLAN Descriptors pool size for tx and rx
Future use (WLAN Driver Suspend/Resume feature flag)
Flag for enable/disabling WLAN Debug logs through Local UART
'use [0:3] bit for select bData 0' will choose default bData. '1' will choose EXT bData. For future, '2' will choose EXT bData 2, etc..
